intro: Alangium meyeri var. macilentum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alangium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a red, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Alangium meyeri var. macilentum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
